thread.title: Welsh international rugby player Elli Norkett dies in car crash aged just 20 - Mirror Online
thread.title_full: Welsh international rugby player Elli Norkett dies in car crash aged just 20 - Mirror Online

author: Nicholas Bieber
title: Welsh international rugby player Elli Norkett dies in car crash aged just 20 - Mirror Online
text:
Welsh international rugby player Elli Norkett dies in car crash aged just 20 Her family has released a statement to say she was 'loved and valued by many' Share Welsh international rugby player Elli Norkett (Photo: walesonline WS) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A woman who tragically died in a crash has been named as Wales rugby international Elli Norkett. 
The 20-year-old, from Llandarcy, Neath, had been the youngest player in the 2013 Rugby World Cup. 
She died in a collision involving two cars on the A4109 between Banwen and Glynneath on Saturday evening. 
Her family has since released a statement, saying: "Elli was a kind hearted and caring final-year student at Cardiff Met University, studying sport development. 
"In 2013 she was the youngest player in the rugby world cup and had gained four Welsh senior caps at the age of 17. Read More Elli was fortunate enough to play on the hallowed turf of Twickenham on two occasions (Photo: Rex) 
"Elli also represented Wales at Sevens and was selected for the Great Britain Students Sevens. 
"On the club front she was proud to represent Swansea Ladies and the Ospreys. 
"Elli was loved and valued by many and has touched the hearts of all her family and friends due to her kind nature and endearing personality. 
"The family wish to be allowed to grieve in peace at this extremely distressing time." Read More Game of Thrones star and UK's tallest man Neil Fingleton dies aged 36 
A 42-year-old woman and her 12-year-old passenger were also involved in the crash, and sustained non-life threatening injuries. 
South Wales Police is continuing to investigate the circumstances around the collision, which involved a silver Toyota Yaris and a silver Vauxhall Insignia. Like us on Facebook
